  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 2 metal paint cans. It does not appear that the cans had metal clips or locking rings, but due to the extent of the spill, it is hard to confirm. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending shipper disposition.

item.title: Report I-2024100114
item.description:
Report I-2024100114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SINDLE TRUCKING, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 76044
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: BAE Systems Ordnance Systems Inc. (OSI) is the operating contractor for Holston Army Ammunition Plant (HSAAP) located at 4509 West Stone Drive in Kingsport, Hawkins County, Tennessee. On September 13, 2024 a hose rupture during offload of a strong nitric acid tanker resulted in a release of acid to the environment. A description of the event is outlined below: The truck driver and operators started the transfer and then moved to observe from a safe location per standard operating procedure. Approximately 10 minutes after the transfer started, personnel observed a NOx cloud and nitric acid spray coming from the back of the tanker. After the wind shifted, the driver made the decision to approach the tanker and activate the emergency stop, ending the release. Upon further investigation after the incident, personnel found the transfer hose had failed. The total amount of nitric acid released from the tanker was 20,988 pounds. It is estimated that approximately 10,494 pounds of nitric acid drained to the spill basin for the tanker pad and into the wastewater collection system. Approximately 10,494 pounds sprayed onto the ground next to the tanker pad. None of the nitric acid traveled to the stormwater channels. Approximately 105 pounds of NOx was released during the event. A hazmat contractor was promptly hired to clean up the release.

item.title: Report E-2024100161
item.description:
Report E-2024100161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed a cargo release of approximately one (1) gallon of Setalux 10-1302 from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon steel drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer floor; personnel cleaned the release using Oil Dri. Dayton Freight personnel advised they generated one (1) five (5) gallon drum containing waste. The fifty-five (55) gallon steel drum was containerized into one (1) sixty-five (65) gallon overpack drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110006
item.description:
Report X-2024110006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill. Hazmat, undeclared despite HAZ svc code. Shipped in unmarked box. No UNPOP markings, no overpack label, no hazmat labels or markings (UN number, proper shipping name), no hazmat paperwork. Pictures 1-4: all sides of outer packaging. Picture 5: inner packaging. 2 x 2L plastic bags of Ecolab 6100659 Maxx Dual Action Floor Cleaner - Bright Speed. Packing slip states UN2491, Ethanolamine solutions, 8, III, CORROSIVE.

item.title: Report E-2024100695
item.description:
Report E-2024100695

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking cap on a poly tote containing hazardous product, GL 120D. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5-cup release onto a the top and side of the tote. The contractor used absorbent pads to clean the release and was able to tighten the loose cap on the tote. One 55- gallon DF containing neutralized impacted absorbents pads and PPE was containerized for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
